item.title: Isolated Thunderstorms Sunday
item.description: Scattered thunderstorms will be more common starting Monday

item.title: Florida Supreme Court upholds death penalty for man convicted of killing 4 children, wife
item.description: Michael Wayne Jones, a Marion County man convicted of murdering his wife and four children, will be put to death after the state Supreme Court upheld his sentence

item.title: Farmer’s Market Sunday Forecast
item.description: Isolated storms are possible near Lakewood Ranch

item.title: Florida firefighters join rescue efforts in Texas amid severe flooding
item.description: Florida firefighters have a history of aiding other communities in crisis.

item.title: Beach & Boating Forecast Sunday
item.description: Thunderstorm activity is lower near the coast today

item.title: New law changes Florida Pre-K program
item.description: A new law in effect ahead of the upcoming school year allows children to transfer to a different Voluntary Prekindergarten program if their family moves.

item.title: Sunday Afternoon and Evening Forecast
item.description: Scattered thunderstorms will be more common starting Monday

item.title: ‘Do you need a straw’
item.description: According to the national park service, plastic makes up almost 90% of trash in our waterways.

item.title: Detained immigrants at ‘Alligator Alcatraz’ say there are worms in food and wastewater on the floor
item.description: People held at the brand new Florida immigration detention center that officials have dubbed “Alligator Alcatraz” say worms turn up in the food, toilets don’t flush and floors flood with fecal waste.
